title: McCormick's stock surges after profit beat and raised guidance
text: Shares of McCormick & Co. Inc. MKC, -0.32% surged 4.3% in premarket trading Tuesday, after the spices company reported a fiscal third-quarter profit that beat expectations and raised its outlook, although sales came up a bit shy. Net income for the quarter to quarter to Aug. 31 rose to $191.9 million, or $1.43 a share, from $173.5 million, or $1.30 a share, in the year-ago period. Excluding non-recurring items, adjusted earnings per share grew to $1.46 from $1.28, above the FactSet consensus of $1.29. Sales increased 0.8% to $1.33 billion, just below the FactSet consensus of $1.34 billion, as consumer segment sales rose 3% to $794.2 million while flavor solutions sales fell 2% to $535.0 million. For fiscal 2019, the company raised its adjusted EPS guidance range to $5.30 to $5.35 from $5.20 to $5.30 but trimmed its sales growth outlook to 1% to 2% from 1% to 3%. The stock has rallied 12.3% year to date through Monday, while the SPDR Consumer Staples Select Sector ETF XLP, +0.49% has climbed 21.0% and the S&P 500 SPX, +0.50% has gained 18.7%.
